meanings.definition: To praise or honor with adoration or worship.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours glorifying her favorite singer by writing a heartfelt letter to him.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to glorify the brave firefighters who saved the town from the wildfire.
meanings.sent3: The children were glorifying their pet hamster by dressing it up in tiny costumes.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting glorified the beauty of nature in a breathtaking way.
meanings.sent5: The movie's soundtrack glorified the emotional scenes, making them even more powerful.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more impressive or important than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement was glorifying the benefits of the new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The politician was accused of glorifying his achievements to gain more votes.
meanings.sent3: The magician was glorifying his simple card trick as the most mind-blowing illusion ever.
meanings.sent4: The book cover glorified the story inside, but the actual content was disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The chef was glorifying the plain dish with fancy garnishes to make it look gourmet.
